column1: I could tell you my adventures—beginning from this morning, said Alice a little timidly; "but it's no use going back to yesterday
column2: because I was a different person then.""Explain all that
column5: said the Gryphon in an impatient tone; explanations take such a dreadful time."So Alice began telling them her adventures from the time when she first saw the White Rabbit; she was a little nervous about it just at first
column6: the two creatures got so close to her
column8: and opened their eyes and mouths so VERY wide
column9: but she gained courage as she went on. Her listeners were perfectly quiet till she got to the part about her repeating
column12: to the caterpillar, and the words all coming different, and then the Mock Turtle drew a long breath, and said, That's very curious."
